title: From queer homes to strip-hop: next-gen photography stars
text:
Azad Amin, winner: Gone with the Water

A boy is swimming in a private pool near the city of Hasankeyf. This city is one of the most historical cities in Turkey. It has about 300 historical monuments. Life began in Hasankeyf about 12,000 years ago – yet it is about to be drowned by the Ilisu Dam , one of 22 dams in the Southeastern Anatolia Project. Its aim is to produce hydroelectric power, flood control and water storage. But Hasankyf, along with 52 other villages, will be submerged by the end of this project
description: Drowning villages, gender identity, migration and a rich twist on homelessness – all subjects tackled by photographers tipped for greatness at this year’s LensCulture Emerging Talent awards
